original_text:
Arcane Reel Chaos
Una delle caratteristiche della casa di sviluppo di giochi da slot NetEnt è la sua capacità di vestire elegantemente ogni genere di abito. Ecco quindi che le varie slot di questa compagnia riescono ad abbracciare generi completamente diversi e passare dai giochi più rilassati a quelli più concitati e misteriosi.
Di quest’ultimo gruppo fa parte la slot Arcane Reel Chaos. Il nome stesso del gioco lascia presagire la direzione verso la quale si muoveranno i rulli che compongono la griglia di gioco.
Cominciamo quindi la nostra analisi andando a vedere prima il comparto grafico e musicale della slot, per poi passare al suo aspetto più tecnico.
Grafica della slot machine
Arcane Reel Chaos della NetEnt ci cala in un ambiente tanto misterioso quanto inquietante. La cornice della griglia di gioco, infatti, sembra essere una chiesa caduta in disuso. Le vetrate a mosaico sono rotte, così come le mura di pietra e la campana abbandonata contro il pavimento.
I suoni che ci accolgono nella nostra prima partita si dividono tra una musica misteriosa che va e viene (si ferma durante le giocate), il suono soffocato di sirene di polizia e di spari. L’impressione che viene data al giocatore è quella di star partecipando a un gioco proibito, di nascosto mentre la città impazzisce attorno a noi.
I simboli che affollano i rulli sono tutti parte del mondo delle carte, passando da quelli classici come A, K, Q a quelli originali di questo gioco dove i personaggi appaiono a mo’ di tarocchi.
Sebbene sia consigliabile non tenere il volume del gioco al massimo perché di tanto in tanto si possono sentire dei picchi, l’audio in generale è abbastanza tenue e alla portata di tutte le orecchie.
Le funzioni e i bonus della slot
Una volta parlato dell’aspetto visivo, che è quello che ci colpisce immediatamente nell’aprire una slot, passiamo al lato più tecnico: come funziona Arcane Reel Chaos della NetEnt?
La griglia di gioco si compone seguendo l’ordinamento più comune nelle moderne slot machine: cinque rulli ruotano su loro stessi andando a disporsi lungo tre assi orizzontali. Il meccanismo qui presente è quindi un 5*3, con quindici simboli che vengono mostrati a ogni giocata.
La peculiarità di questa slot è il gran numero di carte speciali che lo compongono: si parte dall’onnipresente carta Wild, rappresentata da una W, che svolge il ruolo di Jolly sostituendo qualsiasi simbolo in qualsiasi combinazione (ad eccezione dei simboli Scatter).
Di tanto in tanto può capitare di assistere all’arrivo di tre simboli Wild impilati l’uno sull’altro, ma questo può capitare solo nel secondo o terzo rullo.
Un’altra carta che si spera di trovare con frequenza è Zero.X. La carta rappresenta dei gemelli siamesi calvi con un gatto Sphinx, siamese anch’esso. Un richiamo al classico villain dei film di James Bond (o alla sua parodia Dr. Male di Austin Power) che permette di ottenere un grande numero di simboli Wild all’interno della giocata in cui appare.
Queste e molte altre funzioni speciali appaiono in questo gioco.
Slot simili ad Arcane Reel Chaos
Se il genere e le funzioni di questa slot ti hanno fatto desiderare altri titoli simili, siamo qui per rispondere alla tua esigenza. Nel cercare un’altra slot che riprenda il tema magico/arcano senza rinunciare ai propri bonus, possiamo suggerire Fortune Teller della Play’n Go, così come Street Magic, sempre della stessa compagnia.
In genere, la NetEnt offre slot con un grande numero di funzioni speciali, da quelle più vicine a questa tematica come Fortune Teller, a quelle più lontane come quelle ispirate alle serie Tv, come ad esempio Vikings.

raw_translation.response:
Arcane Reel Chaos - A Masterfully Designed Slot Game

NetEnt, the esteemed slot game developer, is known for being able to dress up any theme with elegance. Thus, this company's various slots can embrace completely different genres, ranging from relaxed to thrilling and mysterious games.

Arcane Reel Chaos is one such game that belongs to the latter category. The name itself implies the direction in which the reels comprising the game's grid will move.

Let's begin our analysis by first examining the slot's graphics and music and then moving on to its technical aspects.

Graphics of the Slot Machine

NetEnt's Arcane Reel Chaos drops us into an environment that is as mysterious as it is unsettling. The frame of the game grid appears to be a derelict church. The mosaic-stained glass windows are broken, as are the stone walls and the abandoned bell lying on the floor.

The sounds that greet us during our first game are divided between a mysterious music that comes and goes (stopping during gameplay), the muffled sound of police sirens and gunfire. The impression given to the player is that of participating in a forbidden game, in secret while the city goes wild around us.

The symbols that populate the reels are all part of the world of cards, ranging from classic ones like A, K, Q, to original ones in this game where characters appear like tarot cards.

While it is advisable not to keep the game volume at its maximum because there may be occasional peaks, the audio, in general, is relatively subdued and within reach of all ears.

Functions and Bonuses of the Slot

Once we have discussed the visual aspect – which is what strikes us immediately when opening a slot – we move on to the more technical side: how does NetEnt's Arcane Reel Chaos work?

The game grid is composed following the most common order in modern slot machines: five reels rotate on their own, arranged along three horizontal axes. The mechanism here is thus a 5*3, with fifteen symbols displayed on every spin.

The peculiarity of this slot is the large number of special cards that make it up: starting with the ubiquitous Wild card, represented by a W, which acts as a Joker, substituting any symbol in any combination (with the exception of Scatter symbols).

From time to time, we may witness the arrival of three stacked Wild symbols, but this can only happen in the second or third reel.

Another card that we hope to encounter frequently is Zero.X, which depicts bald Siamese twins with a Sphinx cat, also a Siamese. A nod to the classic villain in James Bond films (or its parody, Dr. Male in Austin Powers) that allows for a significant number of Wild symbols to appear in the game round in which it appears.

These and many other special features appear in this game.

Similar Slots to Arcane Reel Chaos

If the genre and features of this slot have made you crave other similar titles, we're here to meet your needs. When searching for another slot that captures the magical/arcanic theme without sacrificing its bonuses, we can suggest Play'n Go's Fortune Teller, as well as Street Magic, also from the same company.

Generally, NetEnt offers slots with a large number of special features, ranging from those closest to this theme, such as Fortune Teller, to those more distant, such as those inspired by TV series, such as Vikings.

Review: Arcane Reel Chaos - A Masterfully Designed Slot Game

NetEnt, the esteemed slot game developer, is known for being able to dress up any theme with elegance. Thus, this company's various slots can embrace completely different genres, ranging from relaxed to thrilling and mysterious games.

Arcane Reel Chaos is one such game that belongs to the latter category. The name itself implies the direction in which the reels comprising the game's grid will move.

Let's begin our analysis by first examining the slot's graphics and music and then moving on to its technical aspects.

Graphics of the Slot Machine

NetEnt's Arcane Reel Chaos drops us into an environment that is as mysterious as it is unsettling. The frame of the game grid appears to be a derelict church. The mosaic-stained glass windows are broken, as are the stone walls and the abandoned bell lying on the floor.

The sounds that greet us during our first game are divided between a mysterious music that comes and goes (stopping during gameplay), the muffled sound of police sirens and gunfire. The impression given to the player is that of participating in a forbidden game, in secret while the city goes wild around us.

The symbols that populate the reels are all part of the world of cards, ranging from classic ones like A, K, Q, to original ones in this game where characters appear like tarot cards.

While it is advisable not to keep the game volume at its maximum because there may be occasional peaks, the audio, in general, is relatively subdued and within reach of all ears.

Functions and Bonuses of the Slot

Once we have discussed the visual aspect – which is what strikes us immediately when opening a slot – we move on to the more technical side: how does NetEnt's Arcane Reel Chaos work?

The game grid is composed following the most common order in modern slot machines: five reels rotate on their own, arranged along three horizontal axes. The mechanism here is thus a 5*3, with fifteen symbols displayed on every spin.

The peculiarity of this slot is the large number of special cards that make it up: starting with the ubiquitous Wild card, represented by a W, which acts as a Joker, substituting any symbol in any combination (with the exception of Scatter symbols).

From time to time, we may witness the arrival of three stacked Wild symbols, but this can only happen in the second or third reel.

Another card that we hope to encounter frequently is Zero.X, which depicts bald Siamese twins with a Sphinx cat, also a Siamese. A nod to the classic villain in James Bond films (or its parody, Dr. Male in Austin Powers) that allows for a significant number of Wild symbols to appear in the game round in which it appears.

These and many other special features appear in this game.

Similar Slots to Arcane Reel Chaos

If the genre and features of this slot have made you crave other similar titles, we're here to meet your needs. When searching for another slot that captures the magical/arcanic theme without sacrificing its bonuses, we can suggest Play'n Go's Fortune Teller, as well as Street Magic, also from the same company.

Generally, NetEnt offers slots with a large number of special features, ranging from those closest to this theme, such as Fortune Teller, to those more distant, such as those inspired by TV series, such as Vikings.

NetEnt's Arcane Reel Chaos sets players in a mysterious and unsettling environment, surrounded by a derelict church and populated with symbols from the world of cards. Review: Arcane Reel Chaos - A Masterfully Designed Slot Game

NetEnt, the esteemed slot game developer, is known for being able to dress up any theme with elegance. Thus, this company's various slots can embrace completely different genres, ranging from relaxed to thrilling and mysterious games.

Arcane Reel Chaos is one such game that belongs to the latter category. The name itself implies the direction in which the reels comprising the game's grid will move.

Let's begin our analysis by first examining the slot's graphics and music and then moving on to its technical aspects.

Graphics of the Slot Machine

NetEnt's Arcane Reel Chaos drops us into an environment that is as mysterious as it is unsettling. The frame of the game grid appears to be a derelict church. The mosaic-stained glass windows are broken, as are the stone walls and the abandoned bell lying on the floor.

The sounds that greet us during our first game are divided between a mysterious music that comes and goes (stopping during gameplay), the muffled sound of police sirens and gunfire. The impression given to the player is that of participating in a forbidden game, in secret while the city goes wild around us.

The symbols that populate the reels are all part of the world of cards, ranging from classic ones like A, K, Q, to original ones in this game where characters appear like tarot cards.

While it is advisable not to keep the game volume at its maximum because there may be occasional peaks, the audio, in general, is relatively subdued and within reach of all ears.

Functions and Bonuses of the Slot

Once we have discussed the visual aspect – which is what strikes us immediately when opening a slot – we move on to the more technical side: how does NetEnt's Arcane Reel Chaos work?

The game grid is composed following the most common order in modern slot machines: five reels rotate on their own, arranged along three horizontal axes. The mechanism here is thus a 5*3, with fifteen symbols displayed on every spin.

The peculiarity of this slot is the large number of special cards that make it up: starting with the ubiquitous Wild card, represented by a W, which acts as a Joker, substituting any symbol in any combination (with the exception of Scatter symbols).

From time to time, we may witness the arrival of three stacked Wild symbols, but this can only happen in the second or third reel.

Another card that we hope to encounter frequently is Zero.X, which depicts bald Siamese twins with a Sphinx cat, also a Siamese. A nod to the classic villain in James Bond films (or its parody, Dr. Male in Austin Powers) that allows for a significant number of Wild symbols to appear in the game round in which it appears.

These and many other special features appear in this game.

Similar Slots to Arcane Reel Chaos

If the genre and features of this slot have made you crave other similar titles, we're here to meet your needs. When searching for another slot that captures the magical/arcanic theme without sacrificing its bonuses, we can suggest Play'n Go's Fortune Teller, as well as Street Magic, also from the same company.

Generally, NetEnt offers slots with a large number of special features, ranging from those closest to this theme, such as Fortune Teller, to those more distant, such as those inspired by TV series, such as Vikings.
